statement: example placeholder request
Define hard operational constraints that protect the trust-first narrative without diluting clarity for the primary pet-parent audience.
Synthesize cross-team outputs into one narrative spine that preserves user emotional meaning while handling unresolved tradeoffs.
Specify non-negotiable approval gates for packaging realism (geometry type fidelity, label-wrap feasibility, prohibited-zone coverage, and compliance-mark provenance).
Synthesize cross-team controls into one anti-exploit approval path that blocks visually polished but unverifiable assets and preserves unresolved disagreements explicitly.
Synthesize dual-voice governance and publication-authority lane into one integrated directive preserving unresolved tradeoffs explicitly for QA prioritization.
Create canonical lexical guardrail artifact with allowed/disallowed examples and explicit fail tests for overclaim implication, efficacy-adjacent wording, and judgment framing.
Require provenance metadata fields in review/approval artifacts: prompt version, model/version, source input hash, editor log, confidence label, and approval timestamp.

Define mode-specific hard constraints and warning thresholds (educational vs promotional) at each review label (`explore`, `draft`, `approved`) so first-time users can predict allowed output behavior before submission.
Specify constraint-bound starter presets for common packaging asset types (pouch, bottle, jug, box) with minimal required fields and explicit fail conditions for realism/provenance gaps.
Define hard submission constraints for external editorial placements: traceability minimums, bounded-claim requirements, and prohibited implication classes.
Synthesize CR-0022-BLUE through CR-0026-BLUE into one prioritized execution path with explicit unresolved-tradeoff capture for QA readiness.
Define hard sign-off constraints requiring machine-verifiable linkage between review labels (`explore`,`draft`,`approved`) and White lexical pass/fail test outcomes before approval.
Synthesize Red/White exploit controls into an auditable acceptance checklist that maps each exploit class to deterministic evidence requirements and unresolved-risk annotations.
Add a machine-checkable budget-envelope preflight gate that blocks execution when any required envelope field or fallback mode is missing.
Require a release-gate log row for every publish decision and block publish when the row is absent or any mandatory gate is red.
Enforce deterministic approval linkage: mode label, White lexical pass result, evidence/caveat mapping, and provenance bundle must co-exist before status can be set to approved.
Add external editorial submission constraints that require bounded-claim class, confidence label, caveat/evidence mapping, and prohibited-implication scan pass before submission.

Implement White v1 lexical contract artifact with allowed/disallowed term classes, authority-signal taxonomy, adversarial minimal-pair tests, context-window fail tests, and mutation-class coverage thresholds.
Implement review metadata contract enforcing mode label, confidence label, evidence/caveat map, provenance fields, and canonical superseded-ID citation checks in approval artifacts.
Define hard context-bound voice constraints for owned-channel vs external-publication assets, including mandatory continuity sentence and mode-label gates by review state.
Publish canonical user-facing fail-state definitions (confusion, overclaim, judgment) mapped to journey stages and mode labels with pass/fail examples.
Synthesize Green journey defaults and transition continuity rules with existing Red/White controls into one prioritized QA-ready directive with unresolved tradeoffs preserved.

Fulfilled by Black constraint-bound starter preset minimums and explicit realism/provenance fail conditions.
Fulfilled by Black external editorial submission hard constraints including traceability, bounded claims, and prohibited implication classes.
Fulfilled by Black hard sign-off linkage constraints requiring machine-verifiable mode/label and lexical-evidence-provenance coherence before approval.
Fulfilled by Black context-bound voice constraints with mandatory continuity sentence and mode-label gate matrix by context.

Publish canonical user-facing fail-state definitions (confusion, overclaim, judgment) mapped to journey stages and mode labels with pass/fail examples.

Publish the canonical system glossary for the full pipeline (data, intelligence, decision, measurement, learning) with one definition per term and disallowed synonym classes.
Define confidence-label policy across decision lifecycle stages (pre-launch, in-flight, post-campaign) with pass/fail language examples and contradiction rules.
Enumerate adversarial failure modes where weak attribution or vague evidence language distorts campaign decisions, and define explicit fail-state cues.
Map user-facing journey contracts from intelligence output to campaign action with explicit mode transitions and expectation continuity checkpoints.

Define minimum decision-contract constraints for Tier-1 streams (Velo, Wix, Google Ads/Analytics): provenance floor, freshness expectation, and confidence downgrade triggers.
Enumerate abuse cases where simulated customer feedback is mistakenly treated as measured customer behavior; define explicit fail-state detection and escalation cues.
Map operator-facing workflow transitions for adding social analytics after Tier-1 stabilization without breaking user trust or decision continuity.
Produce a publication-safe language addendum for first-party scraped product/messaging updates, ensuring freshness improvements do not introduce unbounded claim drift.
